mods.note: '0 BRITISH CONSULATE MUSCAT PILE NO: 6/30 NAME OF FILE: FOREIGN INTERS ST S: SA’UDI ARABIAN AFFAIRS.VI FOREIGN INTERESTS * G. GAUDI ARABIA (4) Gaudi Arabian Affairs. ^rom To Previous Numberextract paragraphs 1 and 4 from Jedda despatch : 0.158 (25 02/14 7/24) dated the 15th October 1935 to His Excellency The Viceroy of India, Foreign and Political Department, New Delhi. 1* I have the honour to infoim your xcellency that during the course of the past few monthe, four separate conaignmante of silver rupees have arrived here from l^dia in ships of the Ifoghal line. The first co. ailment, ' recorded at paragraph 145 of the Jeada Report for Kay, arrived by the &• s* '’^avi' about the middle of hay and coiislsted of Rupees 400,000. It was followed on June 10th by a second conaigiiment of an unspecified quantity of specie by the s.s. *Jehangir* t and in September by a further shipment also by the a. a.'Jehangir*, of rupees i 120,000, to vhich a reference was made in Jedda Report for that month, paragraph 290, and by a consi rment of twenty- five cases contal 1 g silver coins, estimated to amount to about Rupees 100,000. by the s.s* , *IelaJfli ,, oi: the 8th October. XXX 4. It may seem uomewhat singular that Ibn Daud should import Rupees for ejd through Jedda, and not via the Persian Gulf, but it ma well be that he prefers in this instance to use a Saudi port. I should, however, be Interested to learn from the Political Resident in the Persian ^Df if similar shipments of Indian currency have come to the notice of * — officers at Lahr&in. cr elsevhere.

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: Foliation: the main foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 5; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An additional foliation sequence is present in parallel between ff 3-4; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled.

mods.abstract: This file consists of a copy of an extract of a letter composed by the British Legation in Jeddah regarding the importation of large numbers of rupees from India into Saudi Arabia through the port of Jedda [Jeddah].
